title: Turtle
content: Look at this cool turtle hiding among the rocks and plants! Turtles are reptiles that carry their homes on their backs wherever they go. This turtle's shell has beautiful patterns that help it blend in with its surroundings. Can you see how the turtle's colors match the rocks and leaves around it? This special camouflage helps keep the turtle safe from animals that might want to hurt it.

educational.kindergarten: Look at this box turtle exploring outside! Box turtles carry their home on their back wherever they go. They can pull their head and legs inside their shell to stay safe.
educational.firstgrade: Look at this amazing box turtle! When box turtles feel scared or need to be safe, they can pull their head and legs into their hard shell. The shell is like a little house that protects them from danger. Box turtles carry their homes wherever they go!
educational.secondgrade: Look at this wonderful box turtle resting among the plants and rocks! Box turtles have hard shells that protect them like a suit of armor. They love to eat plants, berries, and insects they find on the forest floor. Can you see how its colorful shell helps it blend in with the leaves and dirt around it?
educational.thirdgrade: Look at this cool turtle hiding among the rocks and plants! Turtles are reptiles that carry their homes on their backs wherever they go. This turtle's shell has beautiful patterns that help it blend in with its surroundings. Can you see how the turtle's colors match the rocks and leaves around it? This special camouflage helps keep the turtle safe from animals that might want to hurt it.
educational.fourthgrade: Look at this incredible box turtle exploring its forest habitat! Box turtles are reptiles that can live for over 100 years and carry their home on their back wherever they go. Notice how its beautiful shell has growth rings like a tree, and how its orange and brown colors help it blend in with fallen leaves. This turtle is searching for food like insects, berries, and mushrooms among the plants and rocks. What do you think this turtle might discover on its slow journey through the forest?
educational.fifthgrade: This box turtle has an incredible built-in home that it carries everywhere! The hard shell is made of bone covered by tough plates that protect the turtle's soft body from predators. Notice how the shell has beautiful rings and patterns - these actually show how old the turtle is, similar to rings on a tree. When danger approaches, box turtles can pull their head, legs, and tail completely inside their shell and close it up tight like a box with a lid!
